Directions: Line a baking sheet with waxed paper; set aside.  In a small bowl, combine the peanut butter, melted milk chocolate and whipped topping.

Beginning at the right of the stem, cut each strawberry in half diagonally.  Scoop out the white portion from the larger half of each berry.  Spread or pipe peanut butter mixture between the two halves; press gently.  Place on prepared pan; refrigerate for 15 minutes or until set.  Dip bottom half of berries in semisweet chocolate.  Place on pan.  Refrigerate for 15-20 minutes or until set.
Ingredients: 5 tablespoons milk chocolate chips, melted and cooled
